episodeTitle: Explosion! The Three Swords Style! Zoro vs. Baroque Works!
description: Zoro continues his battle against Baroque Works agents at Whisky Peak, testing his new swords from Loguetown. As he defeats the bounty hunters one by one, Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine arrive with a mission to eliminate the spies who have infiltrated the organization.

events.title: Zoro Fights the Baroque Works Billions
events.description: Zoro continues his assault on the Baroque Works bounty hunters in Whisky Peak. The Billions attempt to surround and shoot him, but Zoro uses stealth and speed to confuse them, causing them to shoot each other instead.
events.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's tactical combat skills and his ability to handle multiple opponents simultaneously.

events.title: Sandai Kitetsu's Cursed Nature Revealed
events.description: During the battle, a Baroque Works agent tries to attack Zoro from behind with a hammer. Without Zoro commanding it, his sword Sandai Kitetsu responds on its own and blocks the attack. This confirms Zoro's suspicion about why the sword is considered cursed.
events.significance: First demonstration of Sandai Kitetsu's cursed properties, showing that the blade has a will of its own and can act independently.

quotes.text: Now I understand why it's cursed.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro realizes the sword acts on its own

events.title: Zoro Tests His New Swords
events.description: Zoro decides to test his new swords Yubashiri and Sandai Kitetsu against the Baroque Works agents. He demonstrates the superior quality and sharpness of these blades compared to his previous weapons.
events.significance: First combat use of the two swords Zoro acquired in Loguetown, showcasing their effectiveness in battle.

events.title: Zoro Defeats Miss Monday
events.description: Zoro faces off against Miss Monday, one of the Baroque Works Frontier Agents. Despite her considerable strength, Zoro defeats her with his superior swordsmanship.
events.significance: Eliminates one of the stronger Baroque Works agents at Whisky Peak.

events.title: Zoro Defeats Mr. 9
events.description: Mr. 9 attempts to fight Zoro using his unique bat weapons, but is quickly overwhelmed and defeated by Zoro's Three Sword Style techniques.
events.significance: Another Baroque Works Frontier Agent is eliminated from the battle.

events.title: Zoro Defeats Miss Wednesday
events.description: Miss Wednesday (Vivi) tries to fight Zoro using her Peacock Slashers and riding on Karoo. However, her attack misses when Karoo panics, and she is ultimately defeated by Zoro.
events.significance: Zoro defeats the disguised Princess Vivi, though he doesn't yet know her true identity.

events.title: Karoo's Debut
events.description: Karoo, Vivi's loyal super spot-billed duck companion, makes his first appearance in the series. He serves as Miss Wednesday's mount during the battle but panics during the fight.
events.significance: Introduction of Karoo, who will become an important companion to Vivi and later travel with the Straw Hat Pirates during the Arabasta Saga.

events.title: Zoro Defeats Mr. 8 (Igaram)
events.description: Mr. 8 (Igaram) engages Zoro in combat using his saxophone guns and curly hair attacks, but is ultimately defeated by Zoro's superior combat abilities.
events.significance: The defeat of Mr. 8 reveals him to be more than just a Baroque Works agent, setting up the revelation of his true identity.

events.title: Nami Wakes Up and Searches for Treasure
events.description: Nami wakes up from her sleep and, noticing the commotion outside, decides to search the town for treasure while everyone is distracted.
events.significance: Shows Nami's opportunistic nature and treasure-hunting priorities even in dangerous situations.

events.title: Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine Arrive
events.description: Officer Agents Mr. 5 (Gem) and Miss Valentine (Mikita) arrive at Whisky Peak. Their presence immediately raises the stakes as they are higher-ranking agents with Devil Fruit powers.
events.significance: Introduction of the first Baroque Works Officer Agents with Devil Fruit abilities, escalating the threat level significantly.

events.title: Bomu Bomu no Mi Revealed
events.description: Mr. 5 demonstrates his Bomu Bomu no Mi (Bomb-Bomb Fruit) powers, showing that he can make any part of his body explode, including his breath and bodily secretions, without harming himself.
events.significance: First appearance of the Bomu Bomu no Mi Devil Fruit, introducing explosive abilities to the series.

events.title: Kiro Kiro no Mi Revealed
events.description: Miss Valentine demonstrates her Kiro Kiro no Mi (Kilo-Kilo Fruit) powers, showing she can change her body weight at will from 1 kilogram to 10,000 kilograms, allowing her to float with her parasol or crush opponents.
events.significance: First appearance of the Kiro Kiro no Mi Devil Fruit, introducing weight manipulation abilities to the series.

events.title: Vivi and Igaram's True Identities Revealed
events.description: Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine reveal that they have come to eliminate Mr. 8 and Miss Wednesday because they are actually Igaram and Princess Nefertari Vivi of the Arabasta Kingdom, who have infiltrated Baroque Works as spies.
events.significance: Major plot revelation that establishes Vivi as a princess and sets up the Arabasta Arc. This reveals the true scope of Baroque Works' conspiracy against the kingdom.

quotes.text: They are important members of the Arabasta Kingdom who know the Boss's secret.
quotes.speaker: Mr. 5
quotes.context: Revealing why Vivi and Igaram must be eliminated

events.title: Baroque Works Boss's Secret Mentioned
events.description: It is revealed that Vivi and Igaram have learned the true identity of Baroque Works' mysterious boss, which is why they must be eliminated. This information is so dangerous that the organization has sent Officer Agents to kill them.
events.significance: Establishes the central mystery of the Arabasta Saga - the identity of Baroque Works' leader and their plans for the kingdom.

quotes.text: Now I understand why it's cursed.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Realizing Sandai Kitetsu acts on its own

quotes.text: They are important members of the Arabasta Kingdom who know the Boss's secret.
quotes.speaker: Mr. 5
quotes.context: Revealing why Vivi and Igaram must be eliminated

themes.description: The episode explores themes of loyalty through Vivi and Igaram's infiltration of Baroque Works to protect their kingdom, contrasted with the deception they must maintain.
themes.symbolism: The masks and disguises of Baroque Works represent the layers of deception in the organization.

themes.description: Zoro tests his new swords and combat abilities against multiple opponents, pushing himself to understand his weapons better.
themes.symbolism: The cursed sword Sandai Kitetsu represents the dangerous power that comes with taking risks.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro demonstrates his combat prowess and tactical thinking while testing his new swords. He learns more about Sandai Kitetsu's cursed nature.
keyActions: Defeats multiple Baroque Works Billions using stealth and tactics
Discovers Sandai Kitetsu acts on its own
Tests Yubashiri and Sandai Kitetsu in combat
Defeats Miss Monday, Mr. 9, Miss Wednesday, and Mr. 8
quotes: Now I understand why it's cursed.

characterSpotlights.development: Vivi's true identity as Princess Nefertari Vivi of Arabasta is revealed, transforming her character from a simple Baroque Works agent to a central figure in the upcoming arc.
keyActions: Identity as Princess Vivi is exposed
Revealed to have infiltrated Baroque Works as a spy

characterSpotlights.development: Mr. 5 is introduced as a dangerous Baroque Works Officer Agent with explosive Devil Fruit powers.
keyActions: Arrives at Whisky Peak with Miss Valentine
Reveals mission to eliminate Vivi and Igaram
Demonstrates Bomu Bomu no Mi powers
quotes: They are important members of the Arabasta Kingdom who know the Boss's secret.

characterSpotlights.development: Miss Valentine is introduced as Mr. 5's partner with weight-manipulation Devil Fruit powers.
keyActions: Arrives at Whisky Peak with Mr. 5
Demonstrates Kiro Kiro no Mi powers

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle sequences between Zoro and the Baroque Works agents compared to the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of two Devil Fruit users working as a team in combat.
Karoo's species, the super spot-billed duck, is unique to the Arabasta Kingdom and is known for exceptional speed.
The ending song 'Watashi ga Iru Yo' by TOMATO CUBE debuted in the previous episode and continues through episode 73.
